title: Supreme Court’s Constitution Bench to take up petitions challenging abrogation of special status under Article 370 on July 11
comments:
>The five-judge Bench, besides the CJI, would have Justices Sanjay Kishan Kaul, Sanjeev Khanna, B.R. Gavai and Surya Kant as Associate Judges. The five judges are the senior most in the court and also members of the Supreme Court Collegium. Justices Khanna, Gavai and Kant are in line to be CJIs as per seniority norm in the future.

Justice Kaul will retire on December 25th this year

It's already a fait accompli. The latter 3 judges are all quite pro-govt; most likely this bench will say there was nothing unconstitutional and ensure all future legal challenges are blocked. 

And in the highly unlikely event that the bench doesn't approve, Modi will simply pass an ordinance - or even a new law - anyway, overruling the SC just like he did in the Delhi case.

So there's only one final outcome out of all this.
I'm guessing a EWS case like 2-3 split. And yes they'll reject any future challenges
Wait a minute... That doesn't sound like a democracy.
